data.text:
Saturday is #SocialJusticeDay.

The #GlobalGoals are a universal call for social justice that seek to address poverty & inequality to leave no one behind. https://t.co/FxRibAf5yN https://t.co/GmiCnvoo98

Vaccines are safe & help prevent millions of deaths every year.

Fair access to #COVID19 vaccines for everyone, everywhere is our best hope to end the pandemic. 

Watch to find out more about how #VaccinesWork. ⬇️ https://t.co/OlRIUpvDUn https://t.co/kfQnUa5yoi

#COVID19 has worsened existing inequalities around the world. 

We need a human-centered response that promotes social justice for everyone, everywhere. 

More on Saturday's #SocialJusticeDay: https://t.co/uwnxdxRQhW via @ILO https://t.co/M8c4S2Mh7F

"It is within our power to build a future of renewable energy and green infrastructure that protects people & planet and ensures prosperity for all.
Let’s get to work."

-- @antonioguterres as US re-joins #ParisAgreement. https://t.co/HjUhpmYPyp https://t.co/37flZjbo8u

Health workers have been on the frontlines of the pandemic, and now they must be first in line for the #COVID19 vaccine -- everywhere. 

Join @WHO and show your support for the equitable rollout of vaccines, starting with healthcare heroes. https://t.co/19WU7VwDb4 #VaccinEquity https://t.co/mWuG0sMA8a

Watch live as @antonioguterres joins US @ClimateEnvoy John Kerry to mark the United States’ re-entry to the #ParisAgreement.

https://t.co/hL6GXbB8ii

Conflict in one country can have regional & global repercussions. 

UN Peacekeepers serve in missions around the world to prevent the spread of conflict & violence. 

More on their efforts from @UNPeacekeeping: https://t.co/wJQAozBoga #A4P https://t.co/5xUZis1yPw

"Yemen is speeding towards the worst famine the world has seen in decades. Children are already starving to death. The world needs to take action now."

@UNReliefChief and @OSE_Yemen brief Security Council on situation in the country. https://t.co/vPhVPY20nt

The #ParisAgreement is an international treaty on the climate emergency, aiming to limit global warming to protect people & planet. 

It offers a meaningful yet flexible framework for all countries to tackle the climate crisis together. https://t.co/lL9hCsVhdS #ClimateAction https://t.co/LFANhTxqFO

"Human well-being lies in protecting the health of the planet. It’s time to re-evaluate & reset our relationship with nature."

-- @antonioguterres at launch of @UNEP report on how to make #PeaceWithNature https://t.co/EekjDSp4vD #ClimateAction https://t.co/0Berbv5vyD

2021 is the International Year of Health and Care Workers, an opportunity to show our appreciation & gratitude for their unwavering dedication in the fight against #COVID19. 

https://t.co/BQT2JvSp6r via @WHO #SupportHealthCareWorkers https://t.co/ZOoT88POBv

"Addressing racism is not a one-time exercise. Racism is a complex cultural phenomenon; combatting it demands action every day, at every level."

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/wKQSELT3uh https://t.co/Ci33dNFdVS

#TBT to 2018 and another snowy day at UNHQ in NYC.

No matter the weather or conditions, the work of the UN continues around the world for everyone, everywhere: responding to #COVID19, preventing conflict, taking #ClimateAction & much more. https://t.co/PY3Cb6a8uL https://t.co/ESMzZI3E1F

"We can defeat this disease. We can get our economies running again. I am convinced it is possible. Let’s make it happen, together."

-- @antonioguterres at Security Council meeting on equitable access to #COVID19 vaccines. https://t.co/S9yDXx2Oy9

Nurses
doctors
sanitation workers
teachers
journalists
truck drivers
grocery store workers
researchers
& all essential workers are risking their well-being to serve their communities.

We thank them for being on the front lines during the #COVID19 pandemic.

🎨: @rubywangart https://t.co/aeKkBkmacc

Amid #COVID19, Carnival ended in Brazil this week without the traditional samba school parades, but with an important message: 

Only vaccines for everyone can bring back the Carnival & so many other activities we miss.

None of us are safe, until all of us are safe. https://t.co/vHCu01efsq

Wednesday's Security Council meeting reinforced @antonioguterres' call for a global ceasefire to ease suffering & enable humanitarian access – including for the delivery of #COVID19 vaccines worldwide.

More on the Secretary-General's appeal for peace: https://t.co/T5sln52sEF

"#COVID19 is the first truly global crisis we have seen in our lifetime – and it will not be the last."

As @UNICEF marks 75 years of working for children, @unicefchief calls on the world to reimagine a better future #ForEveryChild. https://t.co/l0Ykmp42Ze
https://t.co/DSCZDn942O

Myanmar: @UNHumanRights independent expert warns about the potential for a sharp increase in violence in the country amid more planned protests. 

The expert stresses that the repression of people's basic liberties and human rights must end immediately. https://t.co/vxqnWgboHU

The rollout of #COVID19 vaccines is generating hope.

We must ensure that everybody, everywhere, can be vaccinated as soon as possible.

-- @antonioguterres tells Security Council. https://t.co/W54t1m97RI https://t.co/EEZolK6969

Plants represent 80% of the food we eat & are key for:

🍏 Food security
👩‍🌾 Farmers' livelihoods 
🌎 A healthy environment 

During the International Year of Plant Health, @FAO has tips about how businesses can help protect plants. 

https://t.co/bONgl1wNV4

Women's meaningful & equal participation has proven to be key for lasting peace agreements. But too often, they are left out of major peace processes. 

More on the critical role of women in achieving all the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/NqiHrc8Ah9 via @UN_Women https://t.co/LQECIFX3qz

The needs of young people must be taken into account in times of crises. Their ideas & solutions can support response measures. 

New guidelines on working with & for youth in crises ➡️ https://t.co/WUWPXwdvYY #YouthCompact https://t.co/wsy4TWpmBM

#COVID19 respects no borders, which is why none of us are safe until all of us are safe.

We need a “people’s vaccine,” that is available & affordable for everyone, everywhere. https://t.co/b91hsqSsLc https://t.co/ebgyDLwYa1

In this all-important election year, I am hopeful that Iraqis can continue to count on the Council’s steadfast support and solidarity.

-- @UNIraq chief Jeanine Hennis-Plasschaert briefs UN Security Council on the situation in Iraq. https://t.co/SX3GYooycZ https://t.co/zriZnhltLc

An Ebola vaccination campaign has been launched in Butembo, Democratic Republic of Congo, one week after the resurgence of the virus. Health workers were the first to be vaccinated. 

@WHOAFRO is supporting the Ebola response. https://t.co/hUuaxK3buv https://t.co/nYKwi9dEml
Some of the world's leading airlines have committed to supporting @UNICEF in its historic mission to transport & deliver #COVID19 vaccines to people around the globe. https://t.co/gBiFfK9Xka

✌ for #Vaccinated

As the global roll-out of #COVID19 vaccines continues, we must ensure everyone everywhere has fair & equitable access to these life-saving shots.

With this pandemic, none of us are safe until all of us are safe.

https://t.co/0GE0wg5dGA

Sustainable development isn't possible if any part of the 🌍 population is excluded. 

The #GlobalGoals aim to reduce all forms of discrimination and inequalities, which have been exacerbated by #COVID19: https://t.co/fRqpuj1y4G https://t.co/KQn5NsBcgF

"Gender equality is possible. We must make it happen. Together."

Among @antonioguterres' priorities for 2021 are gender equality as well as #COVID19 recovery and #ClimateAction. https://t.co/rxXHMRQosL https://t.co/TwMxVd7NwM

A hungry child also means a family struggling to survive. 

Healthy snacks for children in school is one of the ways @WFP supports families in Yemen. https://t.co/tc8gx5bz7p https://t.co/GLqTWesBXs

"The UN stands with the people of Myanmar in their pursuit of democracy, peace, human rights & the rule of law."

@antonioguterres says that Myanmar’s military and police must ensure the right of peaceful assembly is fully respected. https://t.co/1GneGV9T06 https://t.co/qKU5c55Mh9

Thanks to @FIFAcom for sharing steps we can all take to keep ourselves & our families safe from #COVID19.

More about the importance of fair access to tests, treatments & vaccines, from @WHO: https://t.co/gQMJ6QJG9y

https://t.co/odZm3e24su

Afghanistan: Increasing violence against human rights defenders & media workers threatens free speech & basic rights of everyone, undermining hopes for peace, according to a new @UNAMAnews report.

https://t.co/TJWSnCwyaK

People become refugees not by choice, but forced by circumstances.

For 70 years, @Refugees has worked to save lives, protect rights & build a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities & stateless people. https://t.co/h9sBXHUK7v

https://t.co/dCmT4GjuGI

The #COVID19 pandemic has created unprecedented demand for data, but persistent gaps remain. 

Latest humanitarian data report highlights importance of relevant, complete & timely data for responding to humanitarian crises. https://t.co/sSV5tUTXsH via @humdata https://t.co/l7dCXbBjSB

Most cases of childhood cancer can be cured. But inequalities in early detection, diagnosis & treatment result in a disproportionate number of deaths in low- & middle-income countries.

More from @pahowho on Monday's International Childhood Cancer Day. https://t.co/LheZDhhPHS https://t.co/bYTPhMc3aY

As people around the world look to build back better from #COVID19, @UNOCHA highlights 10 humanitarian crises that will need continued support in 2021 amid the pandemic recovery. https://t.co/UOBSbsW5ZP

1/3 of our food is lost or wasted.

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero and help protect our planet by buying 'ugly' fruit & vegetables, purchasing local foods, learning how to best store food, eating leftovers & composting. https://t.co/nAjeCAHlAC #ActNow https://t.co/RCcMsuTdKQ

When Holocaust distortion is left unchallenged, it can lead to Holocaust denial, antisemitism, conspiracy myths & dangerous forms of nationalism.

We can all do our part to #ProtectTheFacts about the Holocaust. https://t.co/uJ3Y1FoTkg https://t.co/emzHCk63Dn

In these challenging times, no act of goodwill is too small in our fight against the #COVID19 pandemic.

Get inspired by the solidarity & kindness in our latest @Twittermoments: https://t.co/XevTDEfBZY

#LoveIsLove ❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

On Sunday's #ValentinesDay, join UN @free_equal and support the fair treatment of lesbian, gay, bi, trans and intersex people everywhere. 
https://t.co/Ljui9G92Ag https://t.co/lyMvlHYkDf

🏙 Buildings can help address the climate crisis. 

🎧 Our latest podcast explores how NYC buildings are taking #ClimateAction by using technology & construction techniques that help drastically reduce the amount of energy required for heating & cooling. 
https://t.co/wx2FEUWgbq

As people celebrate Sunday's #ValentinesDay, we honour the men & women #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping, many of whom have continued their life-saving work throughout the #COVID19 crisis, often far from their loved ones.

https://t.co/2HvdaSZNYA

📸: The "Ark of Return" at UNHQ honours the victims of slavery & highlights the legacy of the slave trade. 

More about the permanent memorial as #BlackHistoryMonth continues: https://t.co/kXV5o4KHwl https://t.co/FXBJ0gilq5

Misinformation during #COVID19 can put lives at risk. 

Take time to verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/fBGWhnc72Q #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/BSAAtrHb66

Yemen: Half of the children under 5-years-old in the country are at risk of acute malnutrition.

UN calls for urgent funding & unhindered access to communities to save lives. https://t.co/WCl6XeSnqf

Colombia announced it will provide temporary protection status to Venezuelan refugees & migrants in the country, giving them access to health & other services.

@UNmigration says the decision serves as an example for the whole world. https://t.co/nTJAWBENzZ https://t.co/LZHVtniIOD

Throwback to 1953, when Audrey Hepburn prepared to record a radio programme for @UNICEF.

On Saturday's #WorldRadioDay, we celebrate radio's ability to broaden horizons, build more harmonious societies, and unite & empower people. https://t.co/EkuaWEFO0f https://t.co/gHthVN1ubF

This #BlackHistoryMonth, take a special Black History Tour from the comfort of your home. 

#VisitUN online and find out about the "Ark of Return" slavery memorial at UNHQ and how you can #FightRacism, prejudice & social injustice: https://t.co/LNuEeeGDtZ https://t.co/AFbXxBAp6E

Happy #WorldRadioDay!

As the world changes, so does radio, the most widely consumed medium. Radio plays a key role in promoting diversity and allowing all voices to be represented and heard. https://t.co/cOr8A0S35B https://t.co/xB2rrjLisr

Myanmar: Punitive actions against those responsible for military take-over of the country must not harm vulnerable communities or compromise humanitarian assistance & fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/wk3WArFEQ4

Thanks to educational radio programs supported by @UNICEF, many kids have been able to keep up with their studies at home amid #COVID19 school closures. 

More about the role of radio as a source of information, learning & inspiration on #WorldRadioDay: https://t.co/EkuaWEFO0f https://t.co/RqjxgpKR5f

"What gives me hope are young people: They know it and they call it."

-- @UNEP chief @andersen_inger talks about the importance of youth taking and demanding #ClimateAction in the latest episode of our Awake At Night podcast. 🎧: https://t.co/q72SPKpcVX https://t.co/PKsGFKZroi

Amid #COVID19, radio has been key to ensure continuity of learning & to fight misinformation. 

On Saturday's #WorldRadioDay, @UNESCO celebrates radio's capacity to evolve, innovate and connect. 

📻 https://t.co/XXRQ3ivTJn

https://t.co/m6DSq0bKfV

"To the people of Myanmar, we express our support for your rights to justice, to freedom, to democratic participation, to personal safety & security."

-- Deputy @UNHumanRights Chief at special session of @UN_HRC on situation in Myanmar. https://t.co/A2AeOx09vf https://t.co/xdUdjnOegu

Using children in armed conflict is a grave child rights violation that must end.

On Friday's Int'l Day against Child Soldiers, @UNICEF tells the true story of a child's escape from militias in South Sudan. https://t.co/Up9A88sNQG #ChildrenNotSoldiers https://t.co/5hMuk8xXxH

From Ukraine to Lebanon, from Somalia to Sri Lanka — the UN works around the world to support communities in their #COVID19 response.

Find some examples in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/kpEuRQSJ62

.@UNICEF helps children released from armed groups build a new future though education, counseling & training. 

More on Friday's International Day against Child Soldiers: https://t.co/AFdeRP4cXR #ChildrenNotSoldiers https://t.co/KnwlbYt1GB

.@UNRWA calling for $1.5 billion to provide essential services to Palestine refugees in 2021. 

Funds needed to address dire humanitarian situation, which drastically deteriorated due to #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/wXX6H4Lq4E

"That the ceasefire in eastern Ukraine has largely held & discussions continue is no substitute for meaningful progress on a durable solution."

@DicarloRosemary expresses deep concern about the recent increase in security incidents in the region. https://t.co/c5gJy7fZSz
See how the UN celebrated women's invaluable contributions to science, including during the #COVID19 pandemic, on Thursday's #WomenInScience Day in these @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/xEkmPrbRKn

Only 10 countries have received 75% of the available doses of the #COVID19 vaccine.

To end the pandemic, the vaccine must be shared fairly. 

None of us are safe until all of us are safe. https://t.co/j4SVI5nQK8 https://t.co/Tj2trqI2bJ

Women scientists are under-represented & struggle to get recognition for their achievements, including their invaluable contributions in the fight against the #COVID19 pandemic.

Thursday is #WomenInScience Day. https://t.co/YkNyTn7LX5 https://t.co/YmiXCjrHvK

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

No act of goodwill is too small in the fight against the pandemic.

🎨: Sarah Symes https://t.co/1MIoSHY5hs

Healthcare workers👩‍⚕️
Vaccine researchers🦠
Innovators🔬
& more.

On Thursday's #WomenInScience Day, meet some of the trailblazing women who are working to keep us safe amid #COVID19 & help the world recover better from the pandemic. https://t.co/YkNyTnpmOD

#ActNow to become part of the zero-waste fashion movement:
🔸 Buy eco-friendly clothes 👕 
🔸 Shop second-hand 👚 
🔸 Keep track of your #ClimateAction progress 👉 https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/UbYepzWmwm

We can all do our part to eliminate the stereotypes, gender bias & discrimination that hold women and girls back from careers in Science, Tech, Engineering and Math. 

Thursday is #WomenInScience Day: https://t.co/xeU57uOBd4 https://t.co/BgcXzpCZkN

Syria: Terrorist groups exploiting #COVID19 to regroup & build momentum, UN Security Council hears on Wednesday.

Socio-economic toll & related political fallout could help terrorists expand radicalization & recruitment efforts. https://t.co/1S1zaorMSO

The world needs science, and science needs women. 👩‍🔬🧪

@UN_Women explains why on Thursday's #WomenInScience Day: https://t.co/fcvDidjBrR https://t.co/DyDCFcrN32

📷: The "Ark of Return" at UNHQ honours the victims of slavery & highlights the legacy of the slave trade. 

More about the permanent memorial as #BlackHistoryMonth continues: https://t.co/1FfazIulW9 https://t.co/WFqJluAoGm

Pulses are one of the most nutritious foods.

On Wednesday's #WorldPulsesDay, @FAO has 10 reasons why you should include pulses in your regular diet. https://t.co/7JcCsqnrr4 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/4MhS8UM62P

Religious sites are symbols of faith, tradition & history. They must be respected & preserved as places where everyone can feel safe.

@UNAOC explains how you can take a stand #ForSafeWorship: https://t.co/uT9CS5kjbR https://t.co/qqsVaJcPLV

Pulses are...
🧂 low in sodium
🌱a great source of plant-based protein
💪 good source of iron

More on the benefits of pulses on Wednesday's #WorldPulsesDay: https://t.co/iSN8YXm8OU via @FAO https://t.co/bfoDUx9kea

Syria: Constructive international diplomacy needed for peace process to move forward, @UNEnvoySyria says after briefing to the Security Council. 
https://t.co/X72QDX4MV6
On Wednesday's #WorldPulsesDay, @FAO explains why pulses are vital for the future of our food. https://t.co/nu3q0pIp5J #GlobalGoals https://t.co/y91ZxGBgTb

➡️ @UNinMyanmar expresses strong concern over reported use of force by security forces against demonstrators in Myanmar. 

➡️ @UN_HRC to hold special session on Friday on impact of crisis on human rights in the country. https://t.co/FcF1v2HLYg

Pulses are vital for our health and nutrition and can help achieve a #ZeroHunger world. 

Wednesday is #WorldPulsesDay. https://t.co/nu3q0pqOeb https://t.co/TafUlgIeT6

Colombia will offer temporary protection status to the 1.7 million displaced Venezuelans living in the country.

This life-changing gesture will give refugees & migrants access to job opportunities, education, vaccine plans & more. https://t.co/Ylh35n4uts https://t.co/OOumLAzG5p
Despite the general cooling influence of "La Niña", land temperatures are expected to be above-normal for most parts of the globe in the coming months, according to @WMO. https://t.co/q8dlH5e84E

#COVID19 has disrupted the education of 1.6 billion children. While online learning offers many opportunities, it also increases the risks of abuse & exploitation. 

On #SaferInternetDay, @GPtoEndViolence explains how we can keep children safe online: https://t.co/dAauZPCpSv https://t.co/xN2GvT5vOS

"As we enter 2021, education must be at the core of pandemic response & recovery efforts."

-- @antonioguterres stresses importance of education amid #COVID19 to reduce inequalities, protect our planet, fight hate speech & more. https://t.co/spBzqxNTiE https://t.co/Kg9QrCBU3w

1 in 3 internet users is a child. 
800+ million children are actively using social media.

On Tuesday's #SaferInternetDay,@GPtoEndViolence explains how you can help keep children safe online: https://t.co/3ZjI5SUCUo 

https://t.co/GizjSxmIbM

Communities, governments, businesses & organizations from all over the world are taking bold #ClimateAction.

The UN Global Climate Action Awards shine a light on some of the world’s most inspiring solutions. @UNFCCC explains how you can apply: https://t.co/eTUAGe2j28 https://t.co/n481kVUxTE

"When we respect nature & our planet, we are respecting ourselves."

In the latest episode of our podcast 'Awake At Night', @UNEP chief @andersen_inger talks to @MelissaFleming about the power and importance of individual #ClimateAction. 🎧: https://t.co/q72SPKpcVX https://t.co/fLYvyf65DB

A better internet starts with each and every one of us. 

Being online has many benefits, especially during #COVID19, but it comes with risks. 

On Tuesday's #SaferInternetDay, @UNICEF has tips on how to protect yourself and others online. https://t.co/C3BEGr6iXg https://t.co/pbIJtgNCkk

Wearing a mask & paying tribute to healthcare heroes are just some of the ways people are showing solidarity during the #COVID19 pandemic.

Our latest @TwitterMoments have more examples of unity amid the crisis: https://t.co/Zp3NdYuyrU

"We simply cannot allow the pandemic to keep us from working together."

-- @antonioguterres urges countries to collaborate ahead of the UN Climate Conference #COP26 to address the climate crisis. https://t.co/44RmeNVFNZ #ClimateAction https://t.co/rQCRHtlNm9

The Human Rights Council reviews the human rights records of all 193 UN member countries — the only process of this kind in existence. 

More on @UN_HRC: https://t.co/gpZHzcxGGX #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/TZjghpZ3Im

As humanitarian emergencies become increasingly prolonged & complex, technology 🖥️🛰️ can help mobilize faster & more efficient responses. 

See how drones help @WFP reach those most in need during a crisis. https://t.co/adUQR8wgtH 

https://t.co/A7CV2UMJtG

❌ Abuse
❌ Catcalling 
❌ Inappropriate sexual comments

Harassment of any form is never okay. 

@UN_Women is working to help create safe public spaces for women. https://t.co/6S5xNMh6i6 https://t.co/VMHGd8Jy4U

#COVID19 has pushed 131 million into extreme poverty. That number could climb to 800 million by 2030 unless we reshape our societies.

This week, experts at #CSocD59 discuss how inclusive social policies can lead to a resilient & sustainable recovery. https://t.co/QBr7Sa7dk7 https://t.co/e0cdRvcUCK

Epilepsy affects around 50 million people worldwide. It's a treatable, neurological disease characterized by recurrent seizures, or brief episodes of involuntary movement.

More on Monday's World #EpilepsyDay: https://t.co/CF1CZbxRqA https://t.co/UGq4cEPj8W
